content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can create the function `clean_column` to clean a column name as follows:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)::String
    # Lowercase it 
    col = lowercase(col)

    # Strip any leading or trailing whitespaces
    col = trim(col)

    # Replace any spaces and hyphens with an underscore
    col = replace(col, r"[ -]+", "_")

    return col
end
```

The function `clean_column` takes a String `col` as input. It first lowers the case of the string using `lowercase`. Then it trims any leading or trailing whitespace from the string using `trim`. Finally, it replaces all spaces and hyphens in the string with underscores using `replace` and a regular expression (`r"[ -]+"`).
